resources.string: Welcome to the 1st Living Album. The Legacy Project is an interactive, hip-hop experience like none other.
Kings No Crowns/// Queens No Crowns is a lifestyle brand "For those who don't need permission for greatness..."

jUSt, pronounced "Just-Us", is all about youth empowerment and healthy and sustainable community building. One of our programs, Books and Bagels, is a cultural community event with free breakfast, books, reading time for the little ones, and workshops and sessions for the older folks. They also provide high schoolers to participate in Global Kids-Arkansas which you more out about below

A summer program in which students from underserved communities go abroad for education and social services projects after receiving domestic tutelage. Also, 10% of all net proceeds of merch and music go towards this cause. For more information, check out HERE

This project has been a labor of love with many different contributors in many different facets. However, we would like to give a huge shout out and note of appreciation to a few of the crowdfunding backers who caused this project to be. We thank all of ya’ll:

Aaron A Carey

Well it took Piph long enough, but it looks like we\'re finally here. I was beginning to think we\'d never take off. \n\nAnyway, I\'m getting ahead of myself. My name is...
Well, now that that\'s out of the way, are you ready to participate in \"The Legacy Project\" experience?

Well cool then, \"I Am Not Them: The Legacy Project\" is not only a long title, but a \"living album\" curated by Big Piph and The FAM. Good music, great people, a few stories, and your engagement will make this an incredible and unique experience. Game changing even. \n\nCan\'t wait to begin, but first... you know my name, but you\'re still a mystery. Let\'s fix that. Nice to meet you...
Well, now that that\'s out of the way, are you ready to participate in \"The Legacy Project\" experience?

Soooo... let's try this again...

Hello, my name is %s. 

Are you ready to participate in the "The Legacy Project" experience? Just choose 1 of the options below...
We\'re officially FAM now and you\'re fully engaged. This should be a real cool journey. We\'ll talk again soon, but til then, look around, tell a friend, and enjoy.\n\nWelcome to The Legacy Project

Good to see you back. As you already know, I'm your pilot through this all, but you should definitely understand that I'm so much more. I know time is valuable in our situation, so if I had to break myself down at-a-glance, I'd say that

 I'm a... 

 Leader 
 Movie Fiend 
 Romantic

Now, help me out, and tell me a little more about yourself. But remember Youtube raised me, so keep it short please.

 I'm a...
And now a picture of you would be great
Cool, well let\'s see what we have
Well cool. Not bad at all. I say we share it with a few folks.

Well, I have a few other logistics to take care of it, so I've got to take off. If you need anything, holla at Piph. He knows how to reach me. 

 Oh, and I forgot to mention, I'm a big music person too. When you get a chance, let me know a song that you feel embodies your greatness in general or just makes you feel epic. I'm always looking for new music.
And since I know you want to listen, here are some of mine:\n
I wasn\'t gonna say anything, but I thought you could do better too. Let\'s try this again.
So, which one do you prefer?

You might not know it yet, but my life has more ups and downs than most. The one person who has always helped me make sense of it all is my little brother. Although I'm known as the determined, focused one, sometimes I struggle. He, however, always has the right amount of chill, mixed with the right levels of raw wisdom to help me get back right. 

Who's that special person for you who keeps you focused? Helps motivate you? Brings you chill when things get crazy? I'd love to know.

As you know, my life has more ups and downs than most, so I\'m a firm believer that everyone needs that one spot they can get away to to ease their mind. I mean, I\'ve travelled all over the world, but there\'s still nothing as relaxing as when I\'m strolling through Newbury Park back home. Something about a 5 am walk when even the sun is hitting the snooze button refreshes me every time. \n\nWhat\'s a special place you have? The gym? A special room? Favorite restaurant? Share with me...

So my life definitely has more ups and downs than most, but my mom told me not to let anyone steal my joy. Now I admit I was a lil hard headed at first, but when I finally listened, I found my love for rock climbing. There\'s something about the total engagement of every body part while being suspended so high in the air that makes me forget all other cares in the world. And when my feet touch the ground again, I feel like I\'m ready for the next battle. \n\nWhat special thing or things you do that keep you motivated? Helps clear your mind? Gets you ready for war? I\'d love to know.
Ahhhh...not bad at all. You like?
Ok, let\'s try that getting that picture again.
Well, I\'m glad you think so too. \nSo how about we share it now? I\'m sure others would want to see and be inspired. It would be great to see theirs as well. Please use #runTLP to tag it, too!
Of Course I Want to Share and See!
And why don\'t we see who else is at the party. Let\'s check out some other folks pics!
You sure you don\'t want to share yours?

Well, I'm glad we had that experience together. Great to know I'm not alone. Anyway, hope you have a good one. Talk to you soon.

 Oh, and when you get a chance, let me know a song that motivates you. Here are some of mine:

Crazy to believe, but I still have a slight fear of heights. I was petrified at first, but I realized the best thing was to just dive in head first. Still... it sure would help if I had a friend on the rest of this journey. Yeah... that\'s a not so subtle hint meaning you.

So check this out, I\'ma work on this height thing before it\'s too late and I just get stuck in my ways. How about you try something too? There may not be time for all, so 1st choice counts. Soooo...\n\nWhich are you up for?

You see that desk your neighbors are moving out? Help them carry it. That lady in front of you whose items look affordable? Gon\' pay for it. You know that irritating homeboy through affiliation who needs a ride to the airport, but doesn\'t have a car? Let him Uber. Well, ok... gon\' give him a ride, but tell him to pay it forward twice.\n\nIt\'s very simple. Sometime today do something nice for someone and expect nothing in return, other than asking them to pay-it-forward too.

There\'s something good to see in everybody. (I think.) Well, why don\'t you let a person know today? \n\nSo here it is, give someone a random, out of nowhere compliment expecting nothing in return. Choose someone whom you normally wouldn\'t tell OR give compliments to multiple people. You have one day. Bold you are...

Now I definitely know habits can't be changed in a day, but the commitments to change them can be made. 

What's that thing you've been planning to switch up, or learn, or stop doing, or do more consistently that you've been putting off? Cook? Rediscover your literacy? Learn how to curse in German? Start those kickboxing classes? 

How about taking a day to figure out the next move and making that commitment?

And if alright with you, please let some other folks know about it too. It\'s not that you\'re bragging (unless you want to), it\'s just that you never know who you\'re inspiring. So go ahead and Twitter, Facebook, or whatever it and give it the tag #TooLateTLP\n\nAnd it\'s playlist time again. What song makes you feel all "I can become a better person", "it\'s gonna be alright", or "save the world-ish"?
And of course you want to know mine too, right? No problem...

Not to put all my business out there, but I kinda hit big on the Powerball today. You already know I quit my other-other job, bought a chain, got a chef, bought my chef a chain, greased Uncle Sam\’s palms, and put the down payment on the Tesla. But perhaps more importantly... I\'m in a giving mood. Matter of fact, I wanna give to those who give.

So here\'s the deal, do you know of any charitable organization that needs some extra financial help? If so, I have a $250 prize (all ones) to give to a cause. I\'m going to choose the top 5 that catch my eye and then present them to you, and a few other FAM members to pick the winner.
Pretty cool, right? Yeah, I am. Well, first we have to get those submissions up and in.
No problem. To submit later or just to check out the submissions, you can always go to www.iamnotthem.com OR www.bigpiph.com.

Oh, and unsure if you heard, but Big Piph tends to get involved in the community from time to time too. Check out the jUSt and Global Kids-Arkansas links in the “More: Partner Organizations” section to find out more and how you can play a part.
And as you should know by now, it\'s music time. What\'s a song you play when you want to get your “activist” on? Rebel, revolutionary music, or just when you want to cause some change? Let me know.

Listen, sometimes you gotta put your cool down.\n\n So, how about we do a fun pic? You know, wild hair, awkward position, no makeup, silly face, having fun, a massive dumb usie, or whatever else you can think of. And if you\'re silly all the time, maybe that means you take a serious shot? I don\'t know, but...
Remember to have fun with it!
You\'re pretty good with these pictures. But what do you think?
Ok. Calm down. It is a good picture though.\n\nSo, you know the routine. How about we share it now? Inspire and be inspired. Please use #getlooseTLP to tag it, too!
Of Course I Want to Share and See!
You sure you don\'t want to share yours?
Well cool. And here are some of the most fun, happy, put your cool down songs I vibe to. Pilot Playlist.

Now, I know you\'re ready for the end of our journey too, but it\'s always good to understand your chill first. So, I\'ve got some questions for you. From the fun, to insightful, to possibly just weird; choose your preferred category. Oh, and you should know that there is nothing recorded and there are no wrong answers; but you can only choose one group. Have fun...
Kickin It. Sound good to me.
Music time. What\'s a song that you love that you wish other people understood better? Or a song that is simple in approach, but seems to pack way more knowledge than meets the eye?
As always, here are a few of mine...
Well, it\'s been real. A pleasure even. Unfortunately, I can\'t share what I\'ll be doing next, but I just may pop up from time to time. Who knows?

In the meantime, know that this was never just me and you on this trip. Along the way, we all didn\'t have the same goals, ideas, or even trajectory; but as you can see below, some of us had more in common than we thought. \n\nAnyway, and more importantly, we all know who we\'re not. Til next time...
